/.title: FFConf ðŸŒŸ UK web conference since 2009
/.description: FFConf is a one-day web development conference in Brighton, UK, featuring eight curated sessions on the future of the web.

/talks.title: All the FFConf Talks since 2009
/talks.description: Watch recordings of past FFConf talks on web development, JavaScript, accessibility, and more.

/articles.title: FFConf Articles: Web Dev Insights
/articles.description: Read articles from the FFConf web development conference in Brighton, UK, covering topics from AI and accessibility to community events and more.

/jobs.title: FFConf Job Board
/jobs.description: Find web development jobs at FFConf, including Software Engineer and Senior Software Engineer roles.

/photos.title: FFConf photos over the years
/photos.description: View photos from previous FFConf web development & JavaScript conferences in Brighton, UK.

/posts.title: FFConf social posts and positive feedback
/posts.description: Our attendees love FFConf, a Brighton web development and JavaScript conference known for its inspiring talks and community.

/history.title: FFConf History: Meet the Team
/history.description: Learn about the founders, Remy & Julie Sharp, and the volunteers who've made FFConf a success since 2009.

/articles/2025-early-bird-closes.title: FFConf Early Bird Tickets Close Soon
/articles/2025-early-bird-closes.description: FFConf's early bird tickets end July 31st; ticket sales close until September 4th. The newsletter also takes a break during this period.

/talks/2023_angela.title: Angela Ricci: Fixing the Front Web
/talks/2023_angela.description: Angela Ricci discusses why the front web became complex and how to improve it at FFConf 2023.

/scholarship.title: FFConf Inclusion Scholarships
/scholarship.description: FFConf offers scholarships to under-represented groups in tech for its Brighton conference. Applications close October 13th.

/inclusion.title: FFConf: Diversity & Inclusion Statement
/inclusion.description: FFConf prioritizes diversity and inclusion, aiming for a representative speaker lineup and transparent commitment to marginalized groups.

/articles/cfp.title: FFConf Call for Papers
/articles/cfp.description: FFConf is accepting talk proposals. Submissions are reviewed continuously; speakers receive travel & accommodation.

/code-of-conduct.title: FFConf Code of Conduct
/code-of-conduct.description: FFConf's code of conduct ensures a safe, respectful environment for all attendees, speakers, sponsors, and volunteers.

/covid.title: FFConf COVID-19 Policy
/covid.description: FFConf's COVID-19 policy prioritizes attendee & speaker safety. Attendees are encouraged to test before attending and masks are welcomed.

/contact.title: Contact FFConf
/contact.description: Contact FFConf via email at events@leftlogic.com for inquiries; talk proposals should be submitted through their CFP process.

/talks/2024_olu.title: Olu Niyi-Awosusi: Build Better Webs
/talks/2024_olu.description: Olu Niyi-Awosusi discusses building diverse, interconnected, and sustainable 'webs' instead of a monolithic internet.

/talks/2024_lÃ©onie.title: AI & Accessibility: The Good, the Bad...
/talks/2024_lÃ©onie.description: LÃ©onie Watson explores the realities of AI and accessibility, separating fact from hype at FFConf.

/talks/2024_andy.title: Resilient Code: Planning & Feedback
/talks/2024_andy.description: Learn to build simpler, more resilient codebases by improving planning and feedback with designer colleagues.

/talks/2024_kimberley.title: Kimberley Cook: Growing a Global Community
/talks/2024_kimberley.description: Kimberley Cook shares her 10-year journey building a global community of 25,000, from London workshops to a worldwide network.

/talks/2024_amy.title: Amy Hupe: Meaning in a Meaningless World
/talks/2024_amy.description: Amy Hupe explores burnout, purpose, and finding meaning in work and life at FFConf 2024.

/talks/2024_mike.title: Debugging the Mind: Critical Thinking for Programmers
/talks/2024_mike.description: Mike Hall discusses critical thinking for programmers, showing how a skeptical approach improves problem-solving and decision-making.

/talks/2024_michael.title: Death & Tech: A FFConf Talk
/talks/2024_michael.description: Michael Kibedi discusses how tech companies' mortality impacts our digital data, raising questions about data longevity.

/talks/2024_imran.title: Imran Afzal: The Art of Reflection
/talks/2024_imran.description: Imran Afzal's FFConf talk explores how reflection fosters self-growth and improves future outcomes.

/talks/2023_amber.title: Overworking & Imposter Syndrome
/talks/2023_amber.description: Amber's FFConf talk addresses imposter syndrome, overworking, and creating inclusive work environments, offering practical solutions and more.

/talks/2023_maggie.title: Maggie Appleton: The Expanding Dark Forest
/talks/2023_maggie.description: Maggie Appleton discusses the impact of generative AI on the web's future, exploring the challenges to human creation and connection.

/talks/2023_ire.title: Web Accessibility: Beyond Semantic HTML
/talks/2023_ire.description: Learn how CSS and JavaScript impact web accessibility and how to use them responsibly to create inclusive experiences for all users.

/talks/2023_steven.title: Ada Lovelace & The First Computer Program
/talks/2023_steven.description: Steven Goodwin's FFConf talk explores Ada Lovelace's pioneering computer program, its function, and its historical context.

/talks/2023_jonathan.title: Neurodiversity in Tech: FFConf 2023
/talks/2023_jonathan.description: Jonathan Fielding's FFConf 2023 talk explores neurodiversity in tech, offering practical strategies for building empathy and inclusion.

/talks/2023_ana.title: Web Speech API & Karaoke
/talks/2023_ana.description: Ana Rodrigues explores the Web Speech API, demonstrating its potential to solve karaoke song limitations.

/talks/2023_salma.title: Salma Alam-Naylor: Entertainment as Code
/talks/2023_salma.description: Learn how live streaming and building silly websites creates community, from Salma Alam-Naylor's FFConf talk.

/talks/2022_finokoye_talk.title: Designing for Inclusion: A FFConf Talk
/talks/2022_finokoye_talk.description: Florence Okoye discusses designing inclusive web experiences using data, research, and critical design principles.

/talks/2022_heydonworks_talk.title: Capitalism, the Web, and You
/talks/2022_heydonworks_talk.description: This talk critiques capitalism's exploitation of web development, labour, and resources, linking economic theory to developer burnout and more

/talks/2022_loftio_talk.title: Design for Developers: FFConf 2022
/talks/2022_loftio_talk.description: Lex Lofthouse's FFConf 2022 talk explores fundamental UI design principles and how to create beautiful designs.

/talks/2022_type__error_talk.title: FFConf 2022: A Love Letter to Personal Websites
/talks/2022_type__error_talk.description: A nostalgic look at personal website evolution and a call to build your own fun, story-telling platform.

/talks/2022_lily_2point0_talk.title: Crochet & Programming: A Yarn Tale
/talks/2022_lily_2point0_talk.description: Explore the surprising parallels between crochet and programming, revealing how crafting patterns mirrors coding logic.

/talks/2022_lil_natw_talk.title: Building a Greener Web: A Developer's Guide
/talks/2022_lil_natw_talk.description: This talk explores the environmental impact of web development and offers practical solutions for developers to build more sustainable web.

/talks/2022_sareh88_talk.title: Digital Exclusion in Healthcare
/talks/2022_sareh88_talk.description: Sareh Heidari discusses digital exclusion in healthcare, exploring how web tech can improve or hinder vulnerable people's access to care.

/talks/2022_rumyra_talk.title: FFConf 2022: Browser Disco - Media APIs
/talks/2022_rumyra_talk.description: Ruth John's FFConf 2022 talk explores current and future media APIs, perfect for web developers.

/talks/empathy.title: Speaking With Empathy: A Stuttering Journey
/talks/empathy.description: This talk recounts a speaker's journey with stuttering, revealing how embracing vulnerability led to professional growth and powerful communication.

/talks/what-does-it-take.title: Becoming a Developer in 2020
/talks/what-does-it-take.description: Amina Adewusi shares her journey of becoming a developer while juggling a full-time job and motherhood.

/talks/getting-more-from-git.title: Getting More From Git
/talks/getting-more-from-git.description: Learn advanced Git commands and history to better manage your project's code version control.

/talks/privacy.title: 8 Unbelievable Things About Web Tracking
/talks/privacy.description: Laura Kalbag's FFConf talk reveals how the web tracks users and explores ways developers can mitigate this.

/talks/from-milliseconds-to-millions.title: From Milliseconds to Millions: Web Performance
/talks/from-milliseconds-to-millions.description: Explore the numbers driving web performance, examining client benefits and industry impact.

/talks/effortless-performance-debugging.title: Effortless Performance Debugging
/talks/effortless-performance-debugging.description: Learn simple, actionable steps to improve website performance by addressing common causes of slowdowns.

/talks/taking-the-web-off-the-screen.title: Taking the Web Off the Screen
/talks/taking-the-web-off-the-screen.description: Explore how web development skills can create generative art in the physical world.

/talks/nerdverse.title: Reinventing Interfaces: A Nerdverse Talk
/talks/nerdverse.description: Suz Hinton explores how modern web interfaces can invigorate small computing spaces and inspire playful experiences.

/talks/mentoring.title: Mentoring in Tech: A FFConf Talk
/talks/mentoring.description: Jo Franchetti discusses mentoring in tech, addressing issues like bad role models and promoting positive change within the industry.

/talks/the-future-of-javascript-machine-.title: The Future of JS & Machine Learning
/talks/the-future-of-javascript-machine-.description: Explore the exciting intersection of JavaScript and machine learning, covering deep learning and more.

/talks/web-animation.title: Practical Web Animation
/talks/web-animation.description: Learn practical web animation techniques, focusing on performance and user experience.

/talks/is-it-possible-to-build-a-truly-d.title: Building a Truly Diverse Tech Community
/talks/is-it-possible-to-build-a-truly-d.description: Jenny Wong discusses creating inclusive tech environments that welcome diverse individuals, challenging the traditional approach.

/talks/back-to-the-future.title: Back to the Future of JS
/talks/back-to-the-future.description: Discover exciting new JavaScript features and proposals that may change how you write code.

/talks/dear-developer.title: Dear Developer: Web Development for Users
/talks/dear-developer.description: This talk discusses the importance of designing websites for all users, not just developers, emphasizing user needs over technical solutions.

/talks/slow-and-loud.title: Slow & Loud: 80s Web Loading Screens
/talks/slow-and-loud.description: Remy Sharp recreates horribly slow and loud 1980s web loading screens, contrasting them with today's high-performance websites.

/talks/weird-web.title: Weird Web & Curious Creation
/talks/weird-web.description: Tim Holman's talk on playful coding and creating weird web projects. Get inspired to explore your creative side!

/talks/rethinking-the-web-platform.title: Rethinking the Web Platform
/talks/rethinking-the-web-platform.description: James Kyle discusses evolving the web for improved education, accessibility, performance, productivity, and design.

/talks/if-youre-going-out-of-san-francis.title: Web Standards: Reaching 4 Billion
/talks/if-youre-going-out-of-san-francis.description: Bruce Lawson discusses bridging the digital divide and the importance of web standards for global access.

/talks/how-the-web-sausage-gets-made.title: How the Web Sausage Gets Made
/talks/how-the-web-sausage-gets-made.description: Monica Dinculescu explains web browser function, web components, and their practical uses.

/talks/lessons-learned-sciencing-the-web.title: Sciencing the Web: Lessons Learned
/talks/lessons-learned-sciencing-the-web.description: Discover what slows down modern mobile apps and how to fix performance issues. Learn from Addy Osmani's FFConf talk.

/talks/my-password-doesnt-work.title: My Password Doesn't Work! - FFConf
/talks/my-password-doesnt-work.description: Blaine Cook's FFConf talk dispels password myths, promoting simpler, more secure online practices.

/talks/memory-dont-forget-to-take-out-th.title: Memory Management in JavaScript
/talks/memory-dont-forget-to-take-out-th.description: Katie Fenn's FFConf talk explains JavaScript's hidden memory management, revealing what happens behind the scenes.

/talks/abstract-art-in-a-time-of-minific.title: Abstract Art & Minification
/talks/abstract-art-in-a-time-of-minific.description: Jenn Schiffer discusses the impact of minification on web design aesthetics and accessibility at FFConf.

/talks/alpha-beta-gamer-dev-mode.title: Alpha, Beta, Gamer: Dev Mode - FFConf
/talks/alpha-beta-gamer-dev-mode.description: A comedian and coder performs video games and stand-up, even creating a game with the audience in 10 minutes.

/talks/next-level-css.title: Next Level CSS at FFConf
/talks/next-level-css.description: Discover advanced CSS features now implemented in browsers, eliminating the need for JavaScript or pre-processors in many cases.

/talks/progressive-web.title: Progressive Web Apps: Inclusivity in Design
/talks/progressive-web.description: Ada Rose Edwards discusses the importance of accessibility in Progressive Web App (PWA) development, ensuring PWAs work for everyone.

/talks/technologic-human-after-all-acces.title: Accessibility Remix: A Daft Punk-inspired talk
/talks/technologic-human-after-all-acces.description: Learn accessibility mechanics in the browser, CSS's role beyond aesthetics, and helpful tools, explained with a Daft Punk twist.

/talks/all-things-continuous.title: Continuous Deployment for Everyone
/talks/all-things-continuous.description: Andrew Martin's FFConf talk on Continuous Deployment, covering strategies for individuals and teams.

/talks/power-of-emoji.title: The Power of Emoji: A FFConf Talk
/talks/power-of-emoji.description: Mariko Kosaka's FFConf talk explores emoji's history, from its Japanese origins to Unicode standardization and modern web usage.

/talks/optimise-your-web-development-wor.title: Optimize Your Web Dev Workflow
/talks/optimise-your-web-development-wor.description: Learn about new DevTools features to enhance your web development workflow, including native Node.js debugging.

/talks/a-brief-history-and-mishistory-of.title: A Brief History of Modularity
/talks/a-brief-history-and-mishistory-of.description: Explore the technical etymology of modularity in software development, examining its past, present, and future.

/talks/artjs.title: Art.js: Creative Coding & Live Session
/talks/artjs.description: Explore creative coding, real-time animations, and data visualization techniques with a live coding session.

/talks/javascript-that-doesnt-hurt-your-.title: JavaScript That Doesn't Hurt
/talks/javascript-that-doesnt-hurt-your-.description: Learn modern JavaScript features, how to use them effectively, and what's coming next.

/talks/svg-in-motion.title: Animating SVGs: A Practical Guide
/talks/svg-in-motion.description: Learn SVG animation techniques, optimization, embedding, and common pitfalls in this comprehensive guide.

/talks/operations-a-developers-guide.title: Operations: A Developer's Guide
/talks/operations-a-developers-guide.description: Learn essential web operations skills to improve your development workflow, covering virtualization, containerization, and server management.

/talks/the-web-audio-phenomenon-that-sha.title: The Web Audio Phenomenon
/talks/the-web-audio-phenomenon-that-sha.description: Explore the odd psychological phenomenon impacting getUserMedia and parallels between learning human and programming languages.

/talks/how-to-win-at-mobile-accessibilit.title: Winning at Mobile Accessibility
/talks/how-to-win-at-mobile-accessibilit.description: Learn how to create accessible and reliable mobile experiences for users with disabilities.

/talks/you-should-use-lessinsert-library.title: Use Less: Choosing the Right Library
/talks/you-should-use-lessinsert-library.description: This talk examines how to assess if a library fits your project, separating hype from reality in web development.

/talks/code-calligrams.title: Code Calligrams: Programming as Art
/talks/code-calligrams.description: Learn creative coding techniques to generate beautiful visuals using web languages.

/talks/a-talk-about-everything.title: Everything Matters: Tech's Systemic Issues
/talks/a-talk-about-everything.description: This talk examines systemic issues in tech, including bias, harassment, and lack of diversity, offering actionable steps for change.

/talks/building-the-physical-web-togethe.title: Building the Physical Web Together
/talks/building-the-physical-web-togethe.description: Scott Jenson's FFConf talk explores collaborative development of the Physical Web.

/talks/moving-seamlessly-through-offline.title: Offline & Online Seamless Apps
/talks/moving-seamlessly-through-offline.description: Learn how to build apps that seamlessly transition between online and offline states using Hood.ie and offline-first principles.

/talks/navigating-open-source.title: Navigating Open Source at FFConf
/talks/navigating-open-source.description: Hannah Wolfe discusses Ghost's approach to distributed, non-profit, sustainable, and open-source development.

/talks/self-hosted-js.title: Self-Hosted JS at FFConf
/talks/self-hosted-js.description: Andy Wingo's FFConf talk explores the JavaScript parts of V8 and SpiderMonkey, implementing an ES.next feature live.

/talks/lean-mean-css-machine.title: Lean Mean CSS Machine: GitHub's Optimization
/talks/lean-mean-css-machine.description: Learn GitHub's CSS optimization techniques for faster rendering and minimal code.

/talks/a-single-page-story.title: A Single Page Story: FFConf Talk
/talks/a-single-page-story.description: Henrik Joreteg discusses single-page apps, their strengths and weaknesses, and the design choices behind Ampersand.js.

/talks/tools-for-the-21st-century-musici.title: 21st Century Music with Web Audio
/talks/tools-for-the-21st-century-musici.description: Learn Web Audio to create real-time instruments and interactive music experiences; discover debugging skills using Firefox developer tools.

/talks/getting-close-with-the-web.title: Getting Close with the Web
/talks/getting-close-with-the-web.description: Ben Foxall explores using the web platform for close-range interactions, beyond global communication.

/talks/es6-uncensored.title: ES6 Uncensored: Go Wild with JavaScript
/talks/es6-uncensored.description: Learn to use ES6 JavaScript features creatively, exploring novel combinations and avoiding restrictive best practices.

/talks/javascript-in-the-real-world.title: JavaScript in the Real World
/talks/javascript-in-the-real-world.description: Learn how to use JavaScript for Arduino, Raspberry Pi, and robotics; control hardware and build your own JavaScript-powered robots.

/talks/mobile-is-not-a-thing-it-is-every.title: Mobile: Not A Thing, It's Everything
/talks/mobile-is-not-a-thing-it-is-every.description: Unlock mobile's potential for web and new communication channels; a talk on content strategy, design, and forecasting methods.

/talks/pushing-the-limits-of-mobile-perf.title: Pushing Mobile Performance Limits
/talks/pushing-the-limits-of-mobile-perf.description: Learn how Mobile Gmail & Docs teams prioritized performance, using known and novel techniques, to achieve success.

/talks/our-web-development-workflow-is-c.title: Broken Web Dev Workflow
/talks/our-web-development-workflow-is-c.description: This talk examines the evolution of web tooling, revealing flaws in current workflows and advocating for a rethink.

/talks/stunning-visuals-with-maths-andno.title: Stunning Visuals with Maths & CSS
/talks/stunning-visuals-with-maths-andno.description: Create stunning mathematical visualizations using only HTML and CSS; this talk deconstructs examples and explains the math involved.

/talks/building-with-web-components-usin.title: Building with Web Components using X-Tags
/talks/building-with-web-components-usin.description: Learn how Web Components (Shadow DOM, HTML Templates, etc.) can build web applications, focusing on mobile development.

/talks/time.title: Jeremy Keith: Time at FFConf
/talks/time.description: Jeremy Keith's FFConf talk explores the relentless passage of time in web development.

/talks/building-web-apps-of-the-future-t.title: Building Web Apps of the Future
/talks/building-web-apps-of-the-future-t.description: Paul Kinlan discusses building amazing web apps using current browser technologies, moving beyond outdated methods.

/talks/writing-testable-javascript.title: Writing Testable JavaScript
/talks/writing-testable-javascript.description: Learn to write testable JavaScript code, covering techniques for proving code works and remains functional during refactoring.

/talks/tales-of-suckage-and-awesomeness.title: Browser Wars: A Web History Lesson
/talks/tales-of-suckage-and-awesomeness.description: Chris Wilson recounts the history of web browsers, from early development to the rise of Ajax and mobile.

/talks/making-things-with-maths.title: Making Things with Maths @FFConf
/talks/making-things-with-maths.description: Steven Wittens demonstrates clever mathematical machines built in a browser, showcasing the power of WebGL, Canvas, and Web Audio.

/talks/is-html-relevent-in-the-era-of-we.title: Is HTML Relevant in the Era of Web Apps?
/talks/is-html-relevent-in-the-era-of-we.description: John Allsopp explores the continued relevance of HTML in web application development, despite the rise of frameworks bypassing it.

/talks/offline-rules-using-new-browser-t.title: Offline Web Apps: Best Practices
/talks/offline-rules-using-new-browser-t.description: Learn how new browser technologies enable offline web apps, improving online UX. Real-world examples from FT & Economist apps.

/talks/how-i-stopped-worrying-and-learne.title: How I Stopped Worrying & Loved <body/>
/talks/how-i-stopped-worrying-and-learne.description: James Pearce discusses the web's future, addressing its shortcomings in a post-PC world.

/talks/exploring-the-game-console-browse.title: Console Browser Landscape Exploration
/talks/exploring-the-game-console-browse.description: Anna Debenham explores the evolving landscape of game console browsers, focusing on new challenges like voice and gesture controls.

/talks/coffeescript-design-decisions.title: CoffeeScript Design Decisions
/talks/coffeescript-design-decisions.description: Jeremy Ashkenas discusses CoffeeScript's design choices, exploring the trade-offs and rationale behind its syntax.

/talks/excessive-enhancement-are-we-taki.title: Excessive Enhancement: Web's Well-being
/talks/excessive-enhancement-are-we-taki.description: This talk explores the impact of rich interfaces on the web, examining the balance between innovation and responsible development.

/talks/respectable-code-editing-in-the-b.title: Respectable Code Editing in the Browser
/talks/respectable-code-editing-in-the-b.description: This talk explores JavaScript-based code editors like CodeMirror and ACE, detailing their implementation and benefits over traditional editors.

/talks/how-we-architected-cloud9-ide-for.title: Cloud9 IDE Architecture on NodeJS
/talks/how-we-architected-cloud9-ide-for.description: Rik Arends discusses the architecture and design decisions behind building and scaling Cloud9 IDE on Node.JS.

/talks/scalable-javascript-application-a.title: Scalable JavaScript Application Architecture
/talks/scalable-javascript-application-a.description: Learn techniques for building large, scalable web apps with JavaScript, focusing on loosely-coupled design and efficient workflows.

/talks/beyond-the-page.title: Beyond the Page: Web App Integration
/talks/beyond-the-page.description: This talk explores using browser APIs like Drag and Drop and Web Intents to create web pages that better integrate with other applications.

/talks/beyond-the-planet-of-the-geeks.title: Beyond the Planet of the Geeks
/talks/beyond-the-planet-of-the-geeks.description: Brendan Dawes discusses bridging the gap between cutting-edge tech demos and real-world impact at FFConf.

/talks/you-gotta-do-what-you-gotta-do.title: You Gotta Do What You Gotta Do - FFConf
/talks/you-gotta-do-what-you-gotta-do.description: Marcin Wichary discusses creating interactive Google Doodles, sharing lessons learned from projects seen by millions.

/talks/less-and-more-how-html5-will-chan.title: HTML5 & The Future of Web Frameworks
/talks/less-and-more-how-html5-will-chan.description: Alex Russell discusses how HTML5, CSS3, and related technologies will change web development, focusing on reduced JavaScript reliance.

/talks/about-the-peer-to-peer-web-and-wh.title: Peer-to-Peer Web: A Gentle Introduction
/talks/about-the-peer-to-peer-web-and-wh.description: This talk introduces the peer-to-peer web, exploring its potential and challenges, and highlighting Apache CouchDB's role.

/talks/batshit-crazy-stuff-youll-be-able.title: Crazy Browser Capabilities
/talks/batshit-crazy-stuff-youll-be-able.description: Explore the amazing possibilities of SVG, CSS3, HTML5, and more in modern browsers; a talk by Paul Rouget.

/talks/bringing-the-same-origin-policy-t.title: Bypassing Same-Origin Policy
/talks/bringing-the-same-origin-policy-t.description: Learn how to responsibly embed web application functionality on third-party sites, overcoming same-origin policy limitations.

/talks/high-performance-browser-games.title: High-Performance Browser Games
/talks/high-performance-browser-games.description: Learn how to create fast, graphically intensive browser games using JavaScript, bypassing Canvas limitations and leveraging hardware acceleration.

/talks/phonegap-the-future-of-mobile-now.title: PhoneGap: Future of Mobile Now
/talks/phonegap-the-future-of-mobile-now.description: Learn to build next-gen mobile apps using widgets & device APIs with PhoneGap. Brian LeRoux shows how to create a W3C widget and deploy it.

/talks/pixel-pushing.title: Pixel Pushing: Dynamic Canvas Effects in JS
/talks/pixel-pushing.description: Seb Lee-Delisle demonstrates creating dynamic canvas effects in JavaScript, including JavaScript within Unity3D for browser games.

/talks/frontloaded-and-zipped-up-do-loos.title: Loose Types & JavaScript Security
/talks/frontloaded-and-zipped-up-do-loos.description: Christian Heilmann discusses JavaScript security challenges and solutions in various environments and addressing browser inconsistencies.

/talks/javascript-from-birth-to-closure.title: JavaScript: From Birth to Closure
/talks/javascript-from-birth-to-closure.description: This talk provides a JavaScript overview, covering its origins, common pitfalls, best practices, and advanced topics like closures and more

/talks/w3c-widgets.title: W3C Widgets & the Mobile Web (FFConf)
/talks/w3c-widgets.description: This FFConf talk explores W3C Widgets, their potential for the mobile web, and the unique challenges of mobile web development.

/talks/new-things-that-html5-provides-to.title: HTML5 for JavaScript Hackers
/talks/new-things-that-html5-provides-to.description: Discover exciting new JavaScript capabilities unlocked by HTML5 advancements, explored by web hacker Stuart Langridge.

/talks/more-accessible-user-interfaces-w.title: Accessible UIs with ARIA
/talks/more-accessible-user-interfaces-w.description: Learn practical tips and design patterns for creating accessible user interfaces using ARIA, improving accessibility for all users.

/talks/optimising-where-it-hurts.title: Optimising JavaScript Performance
/talks/optimising-where-it-hurts.description: Learn practical JavaScript optimization techniques to improve web page performance and overcome common challenges.

/talks/node.title: Node.js Talk at FFConf 2009
/talks/node.description: Simon Willison's FFConf 2009 talk on cross-domain JavaScript techniques and HTML5's role in data mashups.

/articles/2025-meet-our-speakers-part-2-.title: FFConf 2025 Speakers: Empathy & Coding
/articles/2025-meet-our-speakers-part-2-.description: Learn about FFConf 2025 speakers, their insights on empathy in coding, and the evolving role of AI in software development.

/articles/2025-meet-our-2025-speakers-se.title: FFConf 2025: SergÃ¨s on Code Cults
/articles/2025-meet-our-2025-speakers-se.description: SergÃ¨s discusses the tribalism in programming languages, exploring why developers fiercely debate preferred tools and technologies.

/articles/2025-meet-our-speakers-part-1-.title: FFConf Speakers: Hellen Ward & More
/articles/2025-meet-our-speakers-part-1-.description: Meet Hellen Ward, discussing bias in tech, and revisit talks on emoji and 128KB web development at FFConf.

/articles/2025-meet-the-speaker-hellen.title: FFConf 2025: Hellen on Bias in Tech
/articles/2025-meet-the-speaker-hellen.description: Hellen Ward discusses bias in tech products and the importance of diverse teams at FFConf 2025. Learn about her background and insights.

/articles/2025-scholarship-programme-is-.title: FFConf Scholarships & AI: Origin Story

/articles/13.description: FFConf 2019 tickets release on July 16th at 10am BST. See design previews & explore a 10-year content archive.

/articles/12.title: FFConf 2019: Tickets & Updates
/articles/12.description: FFConf 2019 tickets aren't sold out yet; another release is coming soon. The conference will be November 8th in Brighton.

/articles/10.description: Announcing the final two speakers for FFConf 2018: Charlie Owen and Tim Holman. Get your tickets now!

/articles/9.title: FFConf Speakers: Jenny Wong & Eleanor Haproff
/articles/9.description: Meet Jenny Wong & Eleanor Haproff, two of FFConf's speakers discussing diversity and AI in the browser. Get your Thursday ticket now!

/articles/8.title: FFConf Speakers Announced (2/4)
/articles/8.description: Meet Jo Franchetti & Michaela Lehr, the next two speakers at FFConf, discussing mentorship and WebXR respectively.

/articles/7.title: FFConf Speakers Announced (1/4)
/articles/7.description: FFConf announces Lisi Linhart (Web Animation) and Willian Martins (Next JavaScript) as speakers. More to come!

/articles/6.description: FFConf v10's speaker lineup and sessions are complete, featuring talks on JavaScript, web animation, diversity, and WebXR.

/articles/5.title: FFConf Location: Brighton & Duke of York's
/articles/5.description: FFConf, a JavaScript event, is held in Brighton, UK, at the historic Duke of York's Picturehouse.

/articles/3.description: FFConf's curator explains their process for selecting content and speakers, emphasizing a focus on new faces and relevant web topics.

/articles/2.description: FFConf's yearly website redesign process, driven by a desire for continuous creation and evolution, is detailed.
